article.headline: W. Carolina 75, Samford 71
article.story: BIRMINGHAM, Ala. -- Keaton Cole hit his fourth 3-pointer of the night with less than two minutes to play, enabling Western Carolina to hold off Samford 75-71 Thursday night in the Southern Conference opener for both teams. Cole's 3-pointer, his fourth of the game, came shortly after Samford (1-4) drew within 66-65 with 1:47 to play. The Bulldogs had battled back to take a 50-45 lead midway through the second half. But Western Carolina (4-4) regained control behind Cole and Brandon Boggs. Boggs led the Catamounts (4-4) with 17 points and had six rebounds. Still, Western Carolina needed Cole's late 3-point heroics to stave off Samford. Freshman Devin McNeil scored a career-high 19 points for the Bulldogs, including three 3-point baskets -- the last a buzzer-beater from halfcourt. Sophomore center Drew Windler had a career-high 20 points. But after Cole's last 3-pointer, Samford never got closer than four points.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
